intro: Evea ipecacuanha, commonly known as the Brazilian ipecacuanha, is a climbing shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Historically, the plant has been used in traditional medicine for its medicinal properties.
